issues.description: The template's Person entity declares the id field as java.util.UUID, while the PersonRepository and service layer use Long as the entity id type (JpaRepository<Person, Long> and methods accepting Long personId). This type mismatch (UUID vs Long) will cause compile/runtime problems (repository generics, repository query methods, service/getById signatures, and tests/REST endpoints that pass Long ids). The solution repository uses Long for the id, so the template's UUID use is inconsistent with the rest of the provided code and with the intended final state.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the entity id type consistent with the repository and the rest of the code. The simplest correction (matching the solution) is to change the Person.id field in the template from java.util.UUID to Long and update the getter/setter accordingly. Concretely: replace 'private java.util.UUID id;' with 'private Long id;', update getId()/setId() signatures and imports. Alternatively, if UUID is required, change PersonRepository and all method signatures that use Long to use java.util.UUID and update tests — but aligning the model to Long matches the provided repository, service, tests, and the solution and is the recommended fix.

issues.description: In the template code the Person entity declares its id field as java.util.UUID (template_repository/src/main/java/de/tum/in/ase/eist/model/Person.java), but the rest of the codebase (controller path variables and repository generic type) uses Long as the identifier type (e.g., PersonRepository extends JpaRepository<Person, Long> and controller methods use Long personId). The problem statement and tests also refer to personId (Long) in endpoints. The solution repository uses Long for Person.id. This mismatch (UUID vs Long) breaks the conceptual mapping for the single 'id' identifier across artifacts and will cause compile/runtime/type errors for students — they cannot easily map the problem's personId and repository/controller signatures to the Person entity in the template.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the identifier type consistent across all artifacts. The simplest fix (and the one used in the solution) is to change the template's Person.id and its getter/setter types from java.util.UUID to Long so they match PersonRepository and controller path variable types. Concretely, in template_repository/src/main/java/de/tum/in/ase/eist/model/Person.java: replace 'private java.util.UUID id;' with 'private Long id;' and update the getId()/setId(Long id) signatures and imports. Alternatively (less preferred here), change repository and controller signatures to use UUID consistently, but prefer aligning the template to the existing repository/controller/test expectations (Long) to avoid breaking student tests and the described endpoints.
